intro: Crinum razafindratsiraea, commonly known as the Madagascar lily, is a striking plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has strap-like, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
